title: How to Bake Devil's Food Cake With Cocoa

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 180ºC/350ºF.
steps.description: Brush a bundt or fancy cake mould with the melted butter. Dust with the cocoa powder reserved for dusting.

steps.headline: Make up the cocoa.
steps.description: Place the cup of cocoa into a small bowl and mix in the boiling water. Stir the contents until the mixture thickens. Leave to cool.

steps.headline: Put the butter, sugar, and vanilla into a bowl.
steps.description: Beat by hand or with an electric mixer until it turns light and fluffy.

steps.headline: Add the eggs one at a time, beating in to combine thoroughly.
Sift in the flours and baking soda.
Pour in the cocoa mixture made earlier.
steps.description: Fold this through the mixture using a metal spoon, until all ingredients are completely combined.

steps.headline: Pour the mixture into the prepared cake mould.
steps.description: Smooth over using a spatula and place in the oven. Bake for 1 1/4 hours or until cooked. Test by piercing with a skewer; if it comes out clean, the cake is cooked.

steps.headline: Remove from oven and leave to stand in the mould for 10 minutes.
steps.description: Turn onto a wire cooling rack after 10 minutes and leave to cool.

steps.headline: Dust with more cocoa or icing sugar if wished.

text: Preheat the oven to 180ºC/350ºF. Brush a bundt or fancy cake mould with the melted butter. Dust with the cocoa powder reserved for dusting. Make up the cocoa. Place the cup of cocoa into a small bowl and mix in the boiling water. Stir the contents until the mixture thickens. Leave to cool. Put the butter, sugar, and vanilla into a bowl. Beat by hand or with an electric mixer until it turns light and fluffy. Add the eggs one at a time, beating in to combine thoroughly.  Sift in the flours and baking soda. Mix through. Pour in the cocoa mixture made earlier. Fold this through the mixture using a metal spoon, until all ingredients are completely combined. Pour the mixture into the prepared cake mould. Smooth over using a spatula and place in the oven. Bake for 1 1/4 hours or until cooked. Test by piercing with a skewer; if it comes out clean, the cake is cooked. Remove from oven and leave to stand in the mould for 10 minutes. Turn onto a wire cooling rack after 10 minutes and leave to cool. Dust with more cocoa or icing sugar if wished. Serve.
